data.title: Poher Weakened as 31% Abstain in Drive Led by Communists POMPIDOU CHOSEN FRENCH PRESIDENT
data.meta_description: defeated by G Pompidou in runoff; got 42% of vote
data.text:
POMPIDOU CHOSEN AS FRENCH LEADER WITH 57% OF VOTE; He Succeeds de Gaulle as President -- Poher Weakened as 31% Abstain in Drive Led by Communists POMPIDOU CHOSEN FRENCH PRESIDENT

POMPIDOU CHOSEN AS FRENCH LEADER WITH 57% OF VOTE; He Succeeds de Gaulle as President -- Poher Weakened as 31% Abstain in Drive Led by Communists POMPIDOU CHOSEN FRENCH PRESIDENT

June 16, 1969

See the article in its original context from

June 16, 1969 , Page 1Buy Reprints

TimesMachine is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers.

Full text is unavailable for this digitized archive article. Subscribers may view the full text of this article in its original form through TimesMachine.

PARIS, Monday, June 16 -- France yesterday elected Georges Pompidou, a Gaullist, to succeed Charles de Gaulle as President of the Republic for the next seven years. Mr. Pompidou defeated Alain Poher, the Interim President, after a short and bitter campaign. He won nearly 58 per cent of the vote. View Full Article in Timesmachine Â»
